intro: Leucas kondowensis, commonly known as the Kondow’s leucas, is a flowering plant native to the eastern regions of Africa. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, opposite leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are typically pale blue to violet, arranged in whorls along the stem, and bloom during the rainy season. Leucas kondowensis is often found in open woodlands and grasslands, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
